sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 120 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C120, the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2, or one of the 487 non-abelian groups of order 120.
message_1: In how many ways can a group of order 120 be isomorphic to the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2?
message_2: The order of the group A5 × C2 × C2 is |A5| × |C2| × |C2| = 60 × 2 × 2 = 240, which is not equal to 120. Therefore, there are no ways for a group of order 120 to be isomorphic to the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2.
